1.caption_en:
This layered architecture diagram shows Lyft’s platform components from user interfaces down through platform services, data handling, core platform, and the AWS services used. It highlights features such as routing/time calculation, adaptive pricing, streaming and batch data processing, cluster/instance management, and AWS components (Kinesis, DynamoDB, RDS, EC2, EKS, S3, Batch).

2.caption_en:
Caption: Diagram of Lyft's platform architecture showing layered components from user interfaces through platform services, data handling, and core platform down to the AWS services used. It highlights specific functions like route/time calculation, adaptive pricing, streaming and batch processing, cluster/instance management, and AWS tools such as Kinesis, DynamoDB, RDS, EC2, Kubernetes Service, S3, and Batch.

3.caption_en: A layered cloud architecture diagram for a real-time mobility platform, showing a mobile user interface on top, platform services (route & time calculation, adaptive pricing, near‑real‑time analytics), data handling (streaming, analysis, aggregation, storage, batch processing, scheduling), and core platform functions (cluster/instance management, storage, CI/CD). The stack is backed by AWS services such as Amazon Kinesis, DynamoDB, RDS, EC2, Amazon EKS (Kubernetes), S3, and AWS Batch.
3.caption_ru: A layered cloud architecture diagram for a real-time mobility platform, showing a mobile user interface on top, platform services (route & time calculation, adaptive pricing, near‑real‑time analytics), data handling (streaming, analysis, aggregation, storage, batch processing, scheduling), and core platform functions (cluster/instance management, storage, CI/CD). The stack is backed by AWS services such as Amazon Kinesis, DynamoDB, RDS, EC2, Amazon EKS (Kubernetes), S3, and AWS Batch.
